the party causing this Lease to be drafted. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.03. Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Lease, each covenant, agreement,
obligation or other provision of this Lease on Tenant&#146;s part to be performed shall be deemed and construed as a separate and independent covenant of Tenant, not dependent on any other provision of this Lease. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.04. All terms and words used in this Lease, regardless of the number or gender in which they are used, shall be deemed to include any other
number and any other gender as the context may require. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.05. Time shall be of the essence with respect to the exercise of any option
granted under this Lease. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.06. Except as otherwise provided herein whenever payment of interest is required by the terms hereof it
shall be at the Interest Rate. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.07. In the event that Tenant is in arrears in payment of basic annual rent or additional rent
hereunder, Tenant waives Tenant&#146;s right, if any, to designate the items against which any payments made by Tenant are to be credited, and Tenant agrees that Landlord may apply any payments made by Tenant to any items it sees fit, irrespective
of and notwithstanding any designation or request by Tenant as to the items against which any such payments shall be credited. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.08. All
Schedules and Exhibits referred to in this Lease are hereby incorporated in this Lease by reference, but in the event of any inconsistencies, this Lease shall govern. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.09. The covenants, conditions and agreements contained in this Lease shall bind and inure to the benefit of Landlord and Tenant and their
respective heirs, distributees, executors, administrators, successors, and except as otherwise provided in this Lease, their assigns. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.10. Tenant hereby acknowledges that in order to avoid delay, this Lease has been prepared and submitted to Tenant for signature with the
understanding that it shall not be deemed an offer by Landlord or bind Landlord unless and until it is executed and delivered by Landlord. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">59 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.11. The exterior walls of the Building, the portions of any window sills outside the windows
and the windows are not part of the demised premises and Landlord reserves all rights to such parts of the Building. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.12. Intentionally
omitted. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.13. Intentionally omitted. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.14. This Lease constitutes the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the matters hereof, and may not be modified except by a
written instrument executed by Landlord and Tenant. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.15. (a) Tenant represents and warrants that to its actual knowledge
(a)&nbsp;Tenant and each person or entity owning an interest in Tenant is (i)&nbsp;not currently identified on the Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons List maintained by the Office of Foreign Assets Control, Department of the Treasury
(&#147;<B><U>OFAC</U></B>&#148;) and/or on any other similar list maintained by OFAC pursuant to any authorizing statute, executive order or regulation (collectively, the &#147;<B><U>List</U></B>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;not a person or entity with
whom a citizen of the United States is prohibited to engage in transactions by any trade embargo, economic sanction, or other prohibition of United States law, regulation, or Executive Order of the President of the United States, and (b)&nbsp;none
of the funds of Tenant have been derived from any unlawful activity with the result that the investment in Tenant is prohibited by law or that this Lease is in violation of law. The term &#147;<B><U>Embargoed Person</U></B>&#148; means any person,
entity or government subject to trade restrictions under U.S. law, including but not limited to, the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, 50 U.S.C. &#167;1701 <I>et seq.</I>, The Trading with the Enemy Act, 50 U.S.C. App. 1 <I>et seq.</I>,
and any Executive Orders or regulations promulgated thereunder with the result that the investment in Tenant is prohibited by law or Tenant is in violation of law. Landlord represents and warrants that to its actual knowledge (a)&nbsp;Landlord and
each person or entity owning an interest in Landlord is (i)&nbsp;not currently identified on the Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons List maintained by the Office of Foreign Assets Control, Department of the Treasury
(&#147;<B><U>OFAC</U></B>&#148;) and/or on any other similar list maintained by OFAC pursuant to any authorizing statute, executive order or regulation (collectively, the &#147;<B><U>List</U></B>&#148;), and (ii)&nbsp;not a person or entity with
whom a citizen of the United States is prohibited to engage in transactions by any trade embargo, economic sanction, or other prohibition of United States law, regulation, or Executive Order of the President of the United States, and (b)&nbsp;none
of the funds of Landlord have been derived from any unlawful activity with the result that the investment in Landlord is prohibited by law or that this Lease is in violation of law. The term &#147;<B><U>Embargoed Person</U></B>&#148; means any
person, entity or government subject to trade restrictions under U.S. law, including but not limited to, the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, 50 U.S.C. &#167;1701 <I>et seq.</I>, The Trading with the Enemy Act, 50 U.S.C. App. 1 <I>et
seq.</I>, and any Executive Orders or regulations promulgated thereunder with the result that the investment in Landlord is prohibited by law or Landlord is in violation of law. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Tenant covenants and agrees (a)&nbsp;to comply with all Legal Requirements relating to money laundering, anti-terrorism, trade embargos
and economic sanctions, now or hereafter in effect, (b)&nbsp;to immediately notify Landlord in writing if any of the representations, warranties or covenants set forth in this paragraph or the preceding paragraph are no longer true or have been
breached, and (c)&nbsp;not to knowingly use funds from any &#147;<B><U>Prohibited Person</U></B>&#148; (as such term is defined in the September&nbsp;24, 2001 Executive Order Blocking Property and Prohibiting Transactions With Persons Who Commit,
Threaten to Commit, or Support Terrorism) to make any payment due to Landlord under this Lease and (d)&nbsp;at the request of Landlord, to provide such information as may be requested by Landlord to determine Tenant&#146;s compliance with the terms
hereof. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">60 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) Tenant hereby acknowledges and agrees that Tenant&#146;s inclusion on the List at any time
during the Term shall be a material default of this Lease, except to the extent that such inclusion is a mistake. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Tenant shall not knowingly permit the demised premises or any portion thereof to be
used or occupied by any person or entity on the List (except to the extent that such inclusion on the List is a mistake) or by any Embargoed Person (on a permanent, temporary or transient basis), and any such use or occupancy of the demised premises
by any such person or entity shall be a material default of this Lease. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.16. Tenant consents to the receipt of promotional electronic
messages from Landlord or its affiliate, but may withdraw such consent at any time. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">41.17. This Lease may be executed in multiple
counterparts, each of which, when assembled to include an original signature for each party contemplated to sign this Lease, will constitute a complete and fully executed original. All such fully executed counterparts will collectively constitute a
single Lease agreement. Tenant expressly agrees that if the signature of Landlord and/or Tenant on this Agreement is not an original, but is a digital, mechanical or electronic reproduction (such as, but not limited to, a photocopy, fax, e-mail,
PDF, Adobe image, JPEG, telegram, telex or telecopy), then, at Landlord&#146;s sole option, such digital, mechanical or electronic reproduction shall be as enforceable, valid and binding as, and the legal equivalent to, an authentic and traditional
ink-on-paper original wet signature penned manually by its signatory. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 42 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SUBSTITUTE SPACE </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">42.01. At any time after the Commencement Date (but not more than once during the Term), Landlord shall have the right to substitute other
space in the Building (&#147;<B><U>Substitute Space</U></B>&#148;) for the demised premises by notice (a &#147;<B><U>Substitution Notice</U></B>&#148;) given to Tenant designating the space so substituted for the demised premises. Landlord agrees
that the Substitution Notice shall not require a Substitution Date (hereinafter defined in <U>Section&nbsp;42.02.(A)</U> hereof) that falls either prior to the first (1st)&nbsp;anniversary of the Rent Commencement Date or during the last year of the
Term, as same may be extended or renewed pursuant to <U>Article 45</U> hereof or otherwise. The Substitute Space shall have a rentable area substantially similar to the demised premises, a similar window line to that of the demised premises, a view
similar to that of the demised premises and shall be on a floor in the Building no lower than the twenty-first (21st)&nbsp;floor. Notwithstanding such substitution of space, this Lease and all the terms, provisions, covenants and conditions
contained in this Lease shall remain and continue in full force and effect, except that the demised premises shall be and be deemed to be the Substitute Space, with the same force and effect as if the Substitute Space were originally specified in
this Lease as the demised premises demised hereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">42.02. In the event of the substitution of space as provided in
<U>Section&nbsp;42.01</U> the following provisions (A)&nbsp;through (D)&nbsp;shall apply: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(A) If the Substitute Space has
a rentable area less than the rentable area of the demised premises, the basic annual rent payable under this Lease and the additional rent payable under this Lease, effective on the date that Tenant takes possession of the Substitute Space (the
&#147;<B><U>Substitution Date</U></B>&#148;), shall be decreased to reflect the lesser number of rentable square feet in the Substitute Space, <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that in no event shall the Substitute Space contain less than ninety-five
(95%)&nbsp;percent of the rentable area of the demised premises. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">61 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(B) Landlord shall, at Landlord&#146;s expense, prepare the Substitute Space in
substantially the same manner and to substantially the same level of finish and layout as Landlord and Tenant have prepared the demised premises (including any subsequent alterations made by Tenant) and Landlord shall have the right to remove any
floor covering, cabinet work, and any other decoration to the Substitute Space, as well as telephone lines and any other communication line to the Substitute Space. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(C) As soon as Landlord has completed preparing the Substitute Space as set forth in <U>Section&nbsp;42.02</U>, Tenant, upon
thirty (30)&nbsp;days&#146; prior written notice, shall move to the Substitute Space at Landlord&#146;s sole cost and expense, and upon failure of Tenant so to move to the Substitute Space, Landlord, as Tenant&#146;s agent, may remove Tenant from
the demised premises to the Substitute Space. The failure of Tenant to move to the Substitute Space pursuant to this <U>Article 42</U> shall be deemed a default under this Lease. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(D) Promptly after Tenant shall enter into occupancy of the Substitute Space, Landlord shall reimburse Tenant, if Landlord
shall have given the Substitution Notice after Tenant has moved into the demised premises, for Tenant&#146;s actual moving expenses, but only to the extent they are reasonable. Upon request from Landlord, Tenant shall supply Landlord with
satisfactory evidence of out-of-pocket expenses incurred by Tenant in moving from the demised premises to the Substitute Space. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">42.03.
Following any substitution of space pursuant to this <U>Article 42</U>, Landlord and Tenant, promptly at the request of either party, shall execute and deliver a supplementary agreement setting forth such substitution of space, the Substitution Date
and the change (if any) in the basic annual rent and additional rent. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 43 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SIGNAGE </U></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">43.01.
Provided that Landlord maintains a directory in the lobby of the Building, Landlord shall make available to Tenant, at no charge to Tenant, Tenant&#146;s pro-rata share of said directory for the listing of Tenant&#146;s name and the names of any of
the officers or employees of Tenant located in the Building and/or the name of any permitted subtenant and the names of any of the officers or employees thereof located in the Building; <I>provided further</I>, if said directory is an electronic
directory, Tenant may list an unlimited number of the aforementioned names therein. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 44 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>TENANT ALLOWANCE </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">44.01. (a) Provided this Lease is in full force and effect and Tenant is not then in default of the payment of basic annual rent under this
Lease or of any other obligations under this Lease beyond any applicable notice and cure periods, Landlord shall pay Tenant toward the cost of the Initial Work up to an amount equal to the Initial Premises Allowance, as adjusted by <U>Schedule C</U>
and by the last sentence of <U>Section&nbsp;2.04</U> hereof, for Hard Costs (as hereinafter defined) and Soft Costs (as hereinafter defined); <I>provided</I>, that Landlord shall not be required to pay from the Initial Premises Allowance for Soft
Costs to the extent such Soft Costs exceed the Initial Premises Soft Costs Maximum (hereinafter defined). The &#147;<B><U>Initial Premises Soft Costs Maximum</U></B>&#148; equals ten percent (10%)&nbsp;of the difference between: (a)&nbsp;the
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">62 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Initial Premises Allowance and (b)&nbsp;the total amount set forth in <U>Schedule C</U> hereof. Subject to the terms of this Article, Landlord shall pay Tenant the Initial Premises Allowance, it
being understood that in no event shall Landlord be obligated to expend any amounts (x)&nbsp;in excess of the Initial Premises Allowance or (y)&nbsp;for Soft Costs in excess of the Initial Premises Soft Costs Maximum. Tenant shall pay its
contractors, subcontractors, materialmen and other professionals for performing the Initial Work, including all costs of the Initial Work in excess of the Initial Premises Allowance. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) &#147;<B><U>Hard Costs</U></B>&#148; means the costs of labor and materials paid for the installation of fixtures, improvements and
appurtenances attached to or built into the demised premises initially demised hereunder, but not including the installation of movable partitions, business and trade fixtures, machinery, equipment, cabling and wiring, furniture, furnishings and
other articles of personal property. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) &#147;<B><U>Soft Costs</U></B>&#148; means the costs, other than Hard Costs, paid in connection
with the preparation of the demised premises initially demised hereunder for Tenant&#146;s occupancy, including fees and expenses of architects, engineers, construction, telecommunication and other consultants. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">44.02. The Initial Premises Allowance shall be disbursed by Landlord in individual progress payments to Tenant, not more often than once
during any calendar month, and in no event before the date falling three (3)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date or after the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date, provided all of the Initial Work for
which reimbursement is sought is substantially complete by the date falling fifteen (15)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date. Each progress payment, however, shall be subject to a ten percent (10%)&nbsp;retainage. If Tenant&#146;s architect
certifies an application for payment with respect to the applicable invoices or portions thereof (or if Landlord otherwise ascertains that the portion of the Initial Work invoiced by the general contractor, for which Tenant requests a progress
payment: (a)&nbsp;is bonafide and being charged legitimately and (b)&nbsp;has been completed), then, so long as Tenant has not breached the Lease (after receipt of any required written notice and beyond the expiration of any applicable cure period),
Landlord shall give Tenant a progress payment check payable to the direct order of the Tenant for the amount shown on said invoice (less the ten percent (10%)&nbsp;retainage) within thirty (30)&nbsp;days, provided all of the Initial Work for which
reimbursement is sought is substantially complete by the date falling fifteen (15)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date and further provided that Landlord first receives from Tenant, no later than the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months
after the Rent Commencement Date, with each individual progress payment request: (1)&nbsp;a bonafide invoice issued by the general contractor for that part of the Initial Work performed by the general contractor for which it has yet to be paid, and
(2)&nbsp;a fully executed and acknowledged partial waiver of construction liens in form satisfactory to Landlord. By the earlier to occur of: (i)&nbsp;the date the Initial Work is substantially completed or (ii)&nbsp;the date falling seventeen
(17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date, Tenant shall give Landlord the following: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">a.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Copy of all government-mandated permits, approvals, authorizations and consents; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">b.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">AIA Document G704, Certificate of substantial completion issued and signed by Tenant&#146;s Architect; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">c.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Release of Lien statements from the general and all sub-contractors associated with the Initial Work; </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">d.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">A set of reproducible drawings of the plans and a &#147;CAD&#148; file (in .DWG or .DXF format) of the &#147;As-Built&#148; plans; and </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">e.</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Copies of paid invoices evidencing the cost of the Initial Work. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">63 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">So long as: (1)&nbsp;Tenant has not breached the Lease (after receipt of any required written notice and beyond
the expiration of any applicable cure period), and (2)&nbsp;Landlord has received from Tenant all of the foregoing documents referenced in paragraphs a., b., c., d., and e. above (in form satisfactory to Landlord) by the earlier to occur of the date
the Initial Work is substantially completed or the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date, then, provided all of the Initial Work for which reimbursement is sought is substantially complete by the date falling
fifteen (15)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date, Landlord shall give Tenant a check payable to the direct order of Tenant for the ten percent (10%)&nbsp;retainage held by Landlord from each and every progress payment. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">44.03. Subject to the terms of this Section, on the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date (<B>time being of
the essence</B>, but subject to extensions due to Force Majeure), any or all of the Initial Premises Allowance that has not been paid to Tenant shall, except as hereinafter set forth, automatically and forever be forfeited, without compensation to
Tenant. Notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in this Section, if no breach has occurred under the Lease on or before the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date (<B>time being of the essence</B>) after
receipt of any required written notice and beyond the expiration of any applicable cure period, then, Landlord shall issue Tenant a rental credit equal to the Credit (hereinafter defined) to be computed by Landlord pursuant to this Section, which
Credit Landlord shall apply in reduction of the immediately following monthly installment(s) of basic annual rent due under the Lease until the Credit is fully expended. The &#147;<B><U>Credit</U></B>&#148; shall be equal to the lesser of:
(a)&nbsp;$99,372.00 (14,196 X $7.00 = $99,372.00), (b)&nbsp;the Adjusted Limit (hereinafter defined) or (c)&nbsp;the positive difference, if any, between: (1)&nbsp;the Initial Premises Allowance minus (2)&nbsp;the sum of: (x)&nbsp;the total amount
set forth in <U>Schedule C</U> hereof and (y)&nbsp;the total amount of the Initial Premises Allowance either (A)&nbsp;that has been requested by Tenant and to which Tenant is entitled in accordance with this Article or (B)&nbsp;reimbursed to Tenant
under this Article for the Initial Work as of the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date. The &#147;<B><U>Adjusted Limit</U></B>&#148; shall be equal to the amount computed by deducting from $99,372.00 all amounts
for Soft Costs (but <U>not</U> in excess of the Initial Premises Soft Costs Maximum) either (I)&nbsp;that have been requested by Tenant and to which Tenant is entitled in accordance with this Article or (II) reimbursed to Tenant under this Article
from the Initial Premises Allowance on or before the date falling seventeen (17)&nbsp;months after the Rent Commencement Date. Notwithstanding anything contained to the contrary in this <U>Article 44</U>, once the Credit is issued, there shall be no
further rent credits under this Article and Tenant shall be forever barred from receiving any reimbursements under this Article for Soft Costs, except to the extent Tenant requested such reimbursements and was entitled to such reimbursements in
accordance with this Article, but has not yet received such reimbursements from Landlord. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">44.04. Tenant hereby invites Landlord to bid on
the Initial Work. Tenant shall have no obligation to accept Landlord&#146;s bid. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 45 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>OPTION TO RENEW </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.01. If the Term of this Lease shall then be in full force and effect and Tenant has complied fully with its obligations hereunder, Tenant
shall have the option to extend the Term of this Lease for a period of five (5)&nbsp;years (the &#147;<B>Renewal Term</B>&#148;) commencing on the day immediately following the Expiration Date, provided however that Tenant shall give Landlord notice
of Tenant&#146;s election to extend the Term no earlier than fifteen (15)&nbsp;months prior to the Expiration Date, nor later than twelve (12)&nbsp;months prior to the Expiration Date, <B><U>TIME BEING OF THE ESSENCE</U></B> in connection with the
exercise of Tenant&#146;s option pursuant to this Article. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">64 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.02. Such extension of the Term of this Lease shall be upon the same covenants and conditions
as herein set forth, except for the basic annual rent (which shall be determined in the manner set forth below) and except that Tenant shall have no further right to extend the Term of this Lease after the exercise of the single option described in
Section&nbsp;45.01. If Tenant shall duly give notice of its election to extend the Term of this Lease, the Renewal Term shall be added to and become a part of the Term of this Lease (but shall not be considered a part of the initial Term), and any
reference in this Lease to the &#147;Term of this Lease&#148;, the &#147;Term hereof&#148;, or any similar expression shall be deemed to include such Renewal Term, and, in addition, the term &#147;Expiration Date&#148; shall thereafter mean the last
day of such Renewal Term. Landlord shall have no obligation to perform any alteration or preparatory or other work in and to the demised premises or provide a tenant improvement allowance and Tenant shall continue possession of the demised premises
in their &#147;as is&#148; condition. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.03. If Tenant exercises its option for the Renewal Term, the basic annual rent during the
Renewal Term shall be the fair market rent for the demised premises, as hereinafter defined. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.04. Landlord and Tenant shall use their
best efforts, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after Landlord receives Tenant&#146;s notice of its election to extend the Term of this Lease for the Renewal Term (&#147;<B>Negotiation Period</B>&#148;), to agree upon the basic annual rent to be paid by
Tenant during the Renewal Term. If Landlord and Tenant shall agree upon the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term, the parties shall promptly execute an amendment to this Lease stating the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term and the new
expiration date. However, the failure by Landlord or Tenant to execute such instrument shall not affect Tenant&#146;s exercise of the option for the Renewal Term, the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term and/or the new expiration date. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.05. If the parties are unable to agree on the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term during the Negotiation Period, then, within fifteen
(15)&nbsp;days after notice from the other party, given after expiration of the Negotiation Period, each party, at its cost and upon notice to the other party, shall appoint a person to act as an appraiser hereunder, to determine the fair market
rent for the demised premises for the Renewal Term. Each such person shall be a real estate broker or appraiser with at least ten (10)&nbsp;years&#146; active commercial real estate appraisal or brokerage experience (involving the leasing of office
space as agent for both landlords and tenants) in the County of Hudson. If a party does not appoint a person to act as an appraiser within said fifteen (15)&nbsp;day period, the person appointed by the other party shall be the sole appraiser and
shall determine the aforesaid fair market rent. Each notice containing the name of a person to act as appraiser shall contain also the person&#146;s address. Before proceeding to establish the fair market rent, the appraisers shall subscribe and
swear to an oath fairly and impartially to determine such rent. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If the two (2)&nbsp;appraisers are appointed by the parties as stated in the immediately
preceding paragraph, they shall meet promptly and attempt to determine the fair market rent. If they are unable to agree within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days after the appointment of the second (2nd)&nbsp;appraiser, they shall attempt to select a third
(3rd)&nbsp;person meeting the qualifications stated in the immediately preceding paragraph within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after the last day the two (2)&nbsp;appraisers are given to determine the fair market rent. If they are unable to agree on the
third (3rd)&nbsp;person to act as appraiser within said fifteen (15)&nbsp;day period, the third (3rd)&nbsp;person shall be appointed by the American Arbitration Association (the &#147;<B>Association</B>&#148;), upon the application of Landlord or
Tenant to the office of the Association nearest the Building. The person appointed to act as appraiser by the Association shall be required to meet the qualifications stated in the immediately preceding paragraph. Each of the parties shall bear
fifty percent (50%)&nbsp;of the cost of appointing the third (3rd)&nbsp;person and of paying the third (3rd)&nbsp;person&#146;s fees. The third (3rd)&nbsp;person, however selected, shall be required to take an oath similar to that described above.
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">65 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The three (3)&nbsp;appraisers shall meet and determine the fair market rent. A decision in which two (2)&nbsp;of
the three (3)&nbsp;appraisers concur shall be binding and conclusive upon the parties. In deciding the dispute, the appraisers shall act in accordance with the rules then in force of the Association, subject however, to such limitations as may be
placed on them by the provisions of this Lease. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.06. After the fair market rent for the Renewal Term has been determined by the
appraiser or appraisers and the appraiser or appraisers shall have notified the parties, at the request of either party, both parties shall execute and deliver to each other an amendment of this Lease stating the basic annual rent for the Renewal
Term and the new expiration date. However, the failure by Landlord or Tenant to execute such amendment shall not affect Tenant&#146;s exercise of the option for the Renewal Term, the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term and/or the new expiration
date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.07. If the basic annual rent for the Renewal Term has not been agreed to or established prior to the commencement of the Renewal
Term, then, Tenant shall pay to Landlord an annual rent (&#147;<B>Temporary Rent</B>&#148;) which Temporary Rent shall be equal to one hundred percent (100%)&nbsp;of the basic annual rent payable by Tenant for the last year of the Term immediately
preceding the Renewal Term. Thereafter, if the parties shall agree upon a basic annual rent, or the basic annual rent shall be established upon the determination of the fair market rent by the appraiser or appraisers, at a rate at variance with the
Temporary Rent (i)&nbsp;if such basic annual rent is greater than the Temporary Rent, Tenant shall promptly pay to Landlord the difference between the basic annual rent determined by agreement or the appraisal process and the Temporary Rent, or
(ii)&nbsp;if such basic annual rent is less than the Temporary Rent, Landlord shall credit to Tenant&#146;s subsequent monthly installment of basic annual rent the difference between the Temporary Rent and the basic annual rent determined by
agreement or the appraisal process. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.08. In describing the fair market rent during the Renewal Term, the appraiser or appraisers shall
be required to take into account the rentals at which leases are then being concluded (as of the last day of the Term) (for five (5)&nbsp;year leases without renewal options with the landlord and tenant each acting prudently, with knowledge and for
self-interest, and assuming that neither is under undue duress) for comparable space in the Building and in comparable office buildings in the vicinity of the Building, taking into account all relevant factors (including whether such other leases
provide for allowances, concessions and/or work). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">45.09. The option granted to Tenant under this <U>Article 45</U> is personal to the
Tenant and to an affiliate (as defined in <U>Section&nbsp;11.02.(b)</U> hereof) and may be exercised only by either Tenant named on the first (1st)&nbsp;and signature page of the Lease or an affiliate (as defined in <U>Section&nbsp;11.02.(b)</U>
hereof) and not by any subtenant, assignee or any successor to the interest of Tenant by reason of any action under the Bankruptcy Code, or by any public officer, custodian, receiver, United States Trustee, trustee or liquidator of Tenant or
substantially all of Tenant&#146;s property. Tenant shall have no right to exercise this option subsequent to the date Landlord shall have the right to give the notice of intention to end the Term, referred to in <U>Section&nbsp;16.02</U> of the
Lease, unless Tenant cures the default within the applicable grace period. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Tenant shall have no right to extend the Term if, at the time Tenant gives notice of its election (i)&nbsp;Tenant (together with any affiliate
as defined in <U>Section&nbsp;11.02.(b)</U> hereof) shall not be in occupancy of at least 75% of the demised premises or (ii)&nbsp;the demised premises (or any part thereof) shall be the subject of a sublease (other than to an affiliate as defined
in <U>Section&nbsp;11.02.(b)</U> hereof or pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;11.02</U>) for greater than 25% of the demised premises. If Tenant shall have elected to extend the Term, such election shall be (at Landlord&#146;s sole option) deemed withdrawn
if, at any time after the giving of notice of such election and prior to the commencement of the Renewal Term, Tenant shall sublease (all or any portion of) the demised premises in excess of 25% of the demised premises (other than to an affiliate as
defined in <U>Section&nbsp;11.02.(b)</U> hereof or pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;11.02</U>). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">66 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 46 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>NOTICE OF SPACE AVAILABILITY </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">46.01. Provided this Lease is in full force and effect and there exists no event of default (that remains uncured after receipt of any
required written notice and beyond the expiration of any applicable cure period), not less than ten (10)&nbsp;days before listing space on the thirty-fifth (35th)&nbsp;floor of the Building for marketing or otherwise offering such space on the
thirty-fifth (35th)&nbsp;floor of the Building to any third party, but after first satisfying any and all applicable options encumbering such space, Landlord shall provide Tenant with a notice (the &#147;<B>Availability Notice</B>&#148;) of such
space in the Building which is then available for leasing, or is expected to become available for leasing, and the date or dates on which such space is expected to become vacant and the rentable square footage thereof. Landlord shall attach to the
Availability Notice floor plans of any such space. The information set forth in any such Availability Notice shall be kept confidential by Tenant and in no event shall any such information be shared with, or released by Tenant to, any other person
or entity. The Availability Notice is being furnished solely for informational purposes and confers no rights or option to Tenant with respect to any such space, nor shall Landlord be subject to liability or damages should Landlord fail to deliver
an Availability Notice or reach agreement with Tenant for such space. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">67 </P>

day and year first above written. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>Landlord: </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>101

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE A </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Legal Description of the Land </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">BEGINNING

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">A-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE B </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Floor Plan </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818stamp149_page01.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">B-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>SCHEDULE C </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Permitted Deductions from Initial Premises Allowance </B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818g80c55.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">C-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818g13t22.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">C-2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818g57f68.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">C-3 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818g53a80.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">C-4 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt" ALIGN="center">


<IMG SRC="g128818g94e69.jpg" ALT="LOGO">
 </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">C-5 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE D </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>INTENTIONALLY DELETED PRIOR TO EXECUTION </B></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">D-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE E </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Cleaning and Janitorial Services </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>A. <U>Nightly Personnel</U>:</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1. All stone, ceramic, tile, marble, terrazzo and other unwaxed flooring (excluding computer room flooring) to be swept nightly using approved
dust-down preparations; wash flooring weekly, scrub when necessary. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2. All linoleum, vinyl, rubber, asphalt, tile and other similar types
of flooring (that may be waxed) (excluding computer room flooring) to be swept nightly using approved dust-down preparation. Waxing, if any, shall be done at Tenant&#146;s expense. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mop up and wash floors for spills, smears and foot tracks throughout, including the demised premises, as needed and wash floor in general as required. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3. All carpeting and rugs to be vacuumed nightly. Cleaning personnel will not move papers or personal items to access an area. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">4. Hand dust with treated cloth and wipe clean all furniture, fixtures and custom wooden window enclosures nightly. Cleaning personnel will
not move papers or personal items to access an area. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">5. Empty and clean all waste receptacles nightly and remove from the demised
premises wastepaper to designated areas. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">6. Empty and clean all ash trays and screen all sand urns nightly. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">7. Dust interior of all waste disposal cans and baskets nightly; damp-dust as necessary. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">8. Wash clean all water fountains and coolers nightly. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9. Dust all floor and other ventilating louvers within reach; damp wipe as necessary. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">10. Dust all telephones as necessary. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">11. Keep locker and slop sink rooms in a neat and orderly condition at all times. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">12. Wipe clean and polish all brass, if necessary, and other bright work nightly. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">13. Sweep all private staircases nightly. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">14. Metal doors of all elevator cars to be properly maintained. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">15. Remove all gum and foreign matter on sight. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">16. Clean all glass furniture tops as needed. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">17. Collect and remove cardboard and waste material (at Tenant&#146;s expense). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">E-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">18. Dust and wash closet and coat room shelving, coat racks and flooring. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">19. Cleaning services related to kitchen and/or pantries will be at Tenant&#146;s expense. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">20. Cleaning of private bathrooms will be at Tenant&#146;s expense. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">21. Cleaning of all interior glass partitions will be at Tenant&#146;s expense. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>B. <U>Periodic Cleaning</U>:</B> </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1. Vacuum all furniture fabric and drapes not less than once a month. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2. Wash and remove all finger marks, ink stains, smudges, scuff marks and other marks from metal partitions, sills, and all vertical surfaces
(doors, walls, window sills) including elevator doors, as necessary. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3. Dust and clean electric fixtures, all baseboards and other
fixtures or fittings as necessary, but not less than once each month. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>C. <U>High Dusting</U></B>. (To be performed once every three
(3)&nbsp;months, unless otherwise specified), and to include, without limitation: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1. Vacuum and dust all pictures, frames, charts, graphs
and similar wall hangings not reached in nightly cleaning. Damp dust as required. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2. Vacuum and dust all vertical surfaces such as walls,
partitions, doors, bucks, ventilating louvers, grilles, high moldings and other surfaces not reached in nightly cleaning. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3. Dust all
overhead pipes, sprinklers, ventilating and air conditioning louvers, ducts, high moldings and other high areas not reached in nightly cleaning. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">4. Dust all venetian blinds. Dust all window frames. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">5. Dust exterior or lighting fixtures. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">6. Wash all furniture glass as needed. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">7. Vacuum and dust ceiling tiles around ventilators and clean air conditioning diffusers as required. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">E-2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE F </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Formula for Cost of Chilled </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Water and Non-Business Hours Hot Water </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1)
Chilled Water </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">Tenant&#146;s Chilled Water Share</TD></TR>

Heating&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D-E </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If more than one tenant in a particular zone requests heating, Tenant&#146;s cost shall be prorated according
to Tenant&#146;s share of the aggregate square footage of tenants requesting heat in that zone. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">F-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>SCHEDULE G </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Form of Estoppel Certificate </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned (&#147;<B><U>Tenant</U></B>&#148;), in consideration of One Dollar ($1.00) and other valuable consideration, the receipt and
sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, hereby certifies to (&#147;<B><U>Landlord</U></B>&#148;), <B>[the holder of any mortgage covering the property]</B> (the &#147;<B><U>Mortgagee</U></B>&#148;) and <B>[the vendee under any contract of sale
with respect to the Property]</B> (the &#147;<B><U>Purchaser</U></B>&#148;) as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1. Tenant executed and exchanged with Landlord a
certain lease (the &#147;<B><U>Lease</U></B>&#148;), dated &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 200 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, covering the floor shown hatched on the plan annexed hereto as <U>Schedule A</U> (the
&#147;<B><U>demised premises</U></B>&#148;) in the building known as 101 Hudson Street located in Jersey City, New Jersey (the &#147;<B><U>Property</U></B>&#148;), for a term to commence (or which commenced) on
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 200 &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, and to expire on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2. The Lease is in full force and effect and has not been modified, changed, altered or amended in any respect. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">3. Tenant has accepted and is now in possession of the demised premises and is paying the full rental under the Lease. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">4. The basic annual rent payable under this Lease is $ &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. The basic
annual rent and all additional rent and other charges required to be paid under the Lease have been paid for the period up to and including
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">5. No rent
under the Lease has been paid for more than thirty (30)&nbsp;days in advance of its due date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">6. All work required under the Lease to be
performed by Landlord has been completed to the full satisfaction of Tenant. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">7. There are no defaults existing under the Lease on the
part of either Landlord or Tenant. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">8. There is no existing basis for Tenant to cancel or terminate the lease. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">9. As of the date hereof, there exists no valid defense, offsets, credits, deductions in rent or claims against the enforcement of any of the
agreements, terms, covenants or conditions of the Lease. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">10. There are no actions, whether voluntary or otherwise, pending against the
Tenant under the bankruptcy laws of the United States or any state thereof. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">11. Tenant acknowledges that Landlord has informed Tenant
that an assignment of Landlord&#146;s interest in the Lease has been or will be made to the Mortgagee and that no modification, revision, or cancellation of the Lease or amendments thereto shall be effective unless a written consent thereto of the
Mortgagee is first obtained, and that until further notice payments under the Lease may continue as heretofore. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">12. Tenant acknowledges
that Landlord has informed Tenant that Landlord has entered into a contract to sell the Property to Purchaser and that no modification, revision or cancellation of the Lease or amendments thereto shall be effective unless a written consent thereto
of the Purchaser has been obtained. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">G-1 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">13. This certification is made to induce Purchaser to consummate a purchase of the Property and
to induce Mortgagee to make and maintain a mortgage loan secured by the Property, knowing that said Purchaser and Mortgagee rely upon the truth of this certification in making and/or maintaining such purchase of mortgage, as applicable. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">G-2 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:8%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">14. Except as modified herein, all other provisions of the Lease are hereby ratified and
confirmed. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="100%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">

<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">

</TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">


<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"></TD></TR>


<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><B>Tenant:</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">By:</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; border-bottom:1px solid #000000; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
